title: Euro: Haaland on target in Dortmund win | Inter leave it late
shortDescription: Borussia Dortmund battled to a 3-2 win at Hoffenheim to close in on Bayern Munich as Erling Haaland made it 56 goals in 57 Bundesliga games for the Ruhr valley club.

title: Papers: Burnley hold talks with Juve over Ramsey loan
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Sunday's national newspapers...

title: Why is it not clicking for Lukaku at Chelsea?
shortDescription: Romelu Lukaku made an explosive start to the season at Chelsea but faces Spurs on Sunday having only scored twice in his last 12 Premier League games.

title: Fourth-tier Kelty knock out Scottish Cup holders St Johnstone
shortDescription: Holders St Johnstone were stunned by fourth-tier Kelty Hearts as the Scottish Cup fourth round concluded on Saturday.

title: Saints hold leaders City to a point
shortDescription: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights from Southampton's draw with Manchester City in the Premier League.

title: Rangnick hails match-winner Rashford: 'One of top strikers in England'
shortDescription: Ralf Rangnick hailed the Old Trafford atmosphere, Man Utd’s defensive display and Marcus Rashford’s impact after the stoppage-time win against West Ham.

title: Saints end Man City's winning run in spicy draw
shortDescription: Southampton ended Manchester City’s winning run of 12 Premier League games after battling away to a 1-1 draw with the league leaders.

title: Neves magic seals Wolves win as drone stops play at Brentford
shortDescription: Ruben Neves' sublime 78th-minute strike helped Wolves secure a 2-1 victory in an eventful game at Brentford after a drone stopped play for 19 minutes.

title: EFL highlights, round-up: Fulham win; Bournemouth lose
shortDescription: Fulham extended their lead in the Sky Bet Championship as they beat Stoke 3-2 while Bournemouth lost to Hull; Wigan, Sunderland and Rotherham all win in League One.

title: Late Rashford strike stuns West Ham and puts Man Utd fourth
shortDescription: Marcus Rashford was the hero for Manchester United as his stoppage-time goal saw them beat West Ham 1-0 and leap above the Hammers into fourth.

title: Rashford stoppage-time winner stuns Hammers
shortDescription: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights from Manchester United's win against West Ham in the Premier League.

title: Manning fires Swans to victory
shortDescription: Ryan Manning's superb long-range strike was enough to seal all three points for Swansea as they overcame Preston 1-0.

title: WBA beat Peterborough after late flurry
shortDescription: West Brom conducted a late show at The Hawthorns as they scored three times in the final 11 minutes to see off lowly Peterborough and reignite their promotion charge.

title: Hull edge past stuttering Bournemouth
shortDescription: Ryan Longman scored an excellent late goal to put another dent in Bournemouth's automatic promotion hopes and lead Hull to a 1-0 win at the Vitality Stadium.

title: Fan protests overshadow Birmingham win
shortDescription: Birmingham put breathing room between themselves and the relegation zone with a 2-1 victory over Barnsley amid fan protests against the owners at St Andrew's.

title: Fulham edge Stoke in thriller to extend lead
shortDescription: Fulham stretched their lead at the top of the Championship to eight points after a 3-2 win over Stoke, despite falling behind inside 45 seconds.

title: Brewster strikes in Sheff Utd win
shortDescription: Sheffield United earned a 2-0 victory over 10-man Luton following second-half goals from Rhian Brewster and Jack Robinson.

title: Ward hits hat-trick in thrilling Huddersfield win
shortDescription: Danny Ward scored a hat-trick as Huddersfield boosted their Championship play-off hopes with a hard-earned 4-3 victory at relegation-threatened Reading.

title: Adomah sees QPR past Coventry
shortDescription: Albert Adomah's 88th-minute header snatched three points for Queens Park Rangers as the promotion chasers beat Coventry 2-1 at the Coventry Building Society Arena.

title: Blackpool battle past Millwall
shortDescription: Shayne Lavery hit the winner as Blackpool earned a deserved 1-0 victory at home to Millwall.
